Package com.swoval.files

Provides classes for monitoring directories for file system updates.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Directory.Converter<R>
    Converts a Path into an arbitrary value to be cached
    Directory.EntryFilter<T>
    Filter Directory.Entry elements
    Directory.Observer<T>
    Provides callbacks to run when different types of file events are detected by the cache
    Directory.OnChange<T>
    Callback to fire when a file in a monitored directory is created or deleted
    Directory.OnError
    Callback to fire when an error is encountered.
    Directory.OnUpdate<T>
    Callback to fire when a file in a monitor is updated
    FileType
    An object that represents a file, directory or symbolic link.
    QuickFile
    Represents a file that will be returned by QuickList.list(java.nio.file.Path, int).
    QuickLister
    Implementation class for QuickList.list(java.nio.file.Path, int)
    Registerable
    Augments the java.nio.file.WatchService with a Registerable.register(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.WatchEvent.Kind<?>...) method.
    WatchedDirectory

    Container class for static options.
    Executor
    Provides an execution context to run tasks.
    FileCache<T>
    Provides an in memory cache of portions of the file system.
    FileCache.Option
    Options for the implementation of a FileCache
    LinkOption  
    NioWrappers  
    PlatformWatcher  
    QuickList
    Provides a fast method #QuickList.list(Path, int, boolean) for listing the files in a directory.
    RegisterableWatchService
    Wraps a WatchService and implements Registerable
    WatchService
    Provides a factory method to make a default Registerable.

Package com.swoval.files Description

Provides classes for monitoring directories for file system updates. The DirectoryWatcher provides a raw api to monitor directories for file events. The FileCache generates an in memory cache of a set of directories that can be listed. The cache can store arbitrary user data that is returned to the user whenever the cache is listed or fires a callback (see Directory.Observer).

The implementation of all of the classes in this package uses only apis and code constructs that can be translated by scalagen. This can cause some of the code to look a bit awkward or not be quite idiomatic java.
